problem_statement: Find the image of the point whose position vector is i + 2j + 3k in the plane r·(i + 2j + 4k) = 38.
overview: We use the formula for the image of a point in a plane. If u is the position vector of the point, n is the normal vector of the plane, and p is the scalar in the equation r·n = p, then the position vector of the image v is given by: v = u + [2(p − (u·n)) / |n|²] n.

step_details.explanation: Identify the vectors u, n, and the scalar p from the given problem.
step_details.side_comment: Here u is the given point’s position vector, n is the plane’s normal vector, and p comes from the plane equation.

step_details.explanation: Write the formula for the image of a point in a plane.
step_details.side_comment: This formula is derived from the condition that the line joining the point and its image is perpendicular to the plane.
Dot product helps measure how much u aligns with the normal n.

step_details.explanation: Compute |n|², the square of the magnitude of n.
step_details.side_comment: This is required in the denominator of the formula.

step_details.explanation: Substitute values of p, (u·n), and |n|² into the formula.

step_details.side_comment: This is the final position vector of the image.

expressions: $\therefore \text{The image of the point } i + 2j + 3k \text{ is } 3i + 6j + 11k$
step_details.side_comment: We have obtained the coordinates of the image using the derived formula.
